test-set.name: prod-DecimalFormatDecl
test-set.description: Tests for the XQuery 3.0 decimal format declaration, controlling the format-number() function

test-case.name: decimal-format-01
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of format-number with 2 arguments, showing zeroes.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format zero-digit="0" grouping-separator="," decimal-separator="."; format-number(2392.14*36.58,'000,000.000000')

test-case.name: decimal-format-02
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of format-number and # and 0 in format string.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format digit="#" grouping-separator="," decimal-separator="."; format-number(12792.14*96.58,'##,###,000.000###')

test-case.name: decimal-format-03
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of format-number on a negative number.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format minus-sign="-" grouping-separator="," decimal-separator="."; format-number(2792.14*(-36.58),'000,000.000###')

test-case.name: decimal-format-04
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of format-number on a negative number; should choose second pattern.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format minus-sign="-" pattern-separator=";" grouping-separator="," decimal-separator="."; format-number(2392.14*(-36.58),'000,000.000###;###,###.000###')

test-case.name: decimal-format-05
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of format-number percentage format.
test-case.test: declare decimal-format local:df minus-sign="-" percent="%" decimal-separator="."; format-number(0.4857,'###.###%', 'local:df')

test-case.name: decimal-format-06
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of format-number per-mille format.
test-case.test: declare decimal-format local:df minus-sign="-" per-mille="‰" decimal-separator="."; format-number(0.4857,'###.###‰')

test-case.name: decimal-format-07
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of format-number currency symbol, which is not supposed to be there.
test-case.test: declare decimal-format local:df minus-sign="-" currency-symbol="¤" decimal-separator="."; format-number(95.4857,'¤###.####', "local:df")

test-case.name: decimal-format-09
test-case.description: Purpose: Test non-default decimal-format on separator characters, changing both.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format decimal-separator="|" grouping-separator="."; format-number(931.4857,'000.000|###')

test-case.name: decimal-format-11
test-case.description: Purpose: Test default decimal-format on pattern-only characters, positive number.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format digit="!" pattern-separator="\"; format-number(26931.4,'+!!!,!!!.!!!\-!!,!!!.!!!')

test-case.name: decimal-format-12
test-case.description: Purpose: Test default decimal-format on pattern-only characters, negative number.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format digit="!" pattern-separator="\"; format-number(-26931.4,'+!!,!!!.!!!\-!!!,!!!.!!!')

test-case.name: decimal-format-13
test-case.description: Purpose: Test default decimal-format on pattern-only characters, negative number and one pattern.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format digit="!" pattern-separator="\"; format-number(-26931.4,'!!!,!!!.!!!')

test-case.name: decimal-format-14
test-case.description: Purpose: Test specified result pattern for infinity.
test-case.test: declare decimal-format local:df2 infinity="off-the-scale"; format-number(1 div 0e0,'###############################', 'local:df2')

test-case.name: decimal-format-15
test-case.description: Purpose: Test specified result pattern for not-a-number.
test-case.test: declare decimal-format local:df2 NaN="non-numeric"; format-number(number('none'), '#############', 'local:df2')

test-case.name: decimal-format-16
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of decimal-format per-mille format with character being changed.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format per-mille="m"; format-number(0.4857,'###.###m')

test-case.name: decimal-format-17
test-case.description: Purpose: Test decimal-format output character for negative, 2 patterns.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format minus-sign="_"; format-number(-26931.4,'+###,###.###;-###,###.###')

test-case.name: decimal-format-18
test-case.description: Purpose: Test decimal-format output character for negative, one pattern.
test-case.test: declare default decimal-format minus-sign="_"; format-number(-26931.4,'###,###.###')

test-case.description: Purpose: Test decimal-format declaration with an unprefixed name.

test-case.description: Purpose: Use escape sequence within decimal format value

test-case.name: decimal-format-40
test-case.description: Purpose: It's OK to use '0' to represent NaN
